sentences.english: It was, for him, as though the rock were a giant hard door into another world.
sentences.chinese: 他觉得那岩石像是通往另外世界的一扇坚实大门。

sentences.english: To overcome this solid steel billets were turned in the center lathe.
sentences.chinese: 为了克服这一坚实的钢片被拒绝的中心车床。

sentences.english: The working class represents the CPC's strongest and most reliable class foundation.
sentences.chinese: 我国工人阶级是我们党最坚实最可靠的阶级基础。

sentences.english: Frost consists of tiny crystals of ice which grow outward from a solid surface.
sentences.chinese: 霜包括从坚实表面增长向外冰的微小的水晶。

sentences.english: This has laid a solid foundation for the follow-up study.
sentences.chinese: 从而为本文的后续研究打下了坚实的基础。

sentences.english: Now Thad has a solid ground for appeal.
sentences.chinese: 现在就有了一个坚实的申诉基础。

sentences.english: If it used with various retanning agents, the fullness of leather was good.
sentences.chinese: 若与多种复鞣材料搭配使用，亦可制得丰满坚实的革。

sentences.english: For all his star-gazing, Sir Arthur's feet were firmly on the ground.
sentences.chinese: 尽管他耽于幻想，亚瑟爵士的足迹却是坚实的。

sentences.english: Sound knowledge and experience with computers.
sentences.chinese: 具坚实的电脑知识和经验。

sentences.english: Now, the stability of the RMB exchange rate still has a firm ground.
sentences.chinese: 现在，人民币汇率的稳定，仍有坚实的基矗。

sentences.english: You can use them to stand tall and firm.
sentences.chinese: 你可以用它来站的更高更坚实。

sentences.english: I used Styrene Solid rod and brass rod to manufacture the Single Bollards.
sentences.chinese: 我用苯乙烯坚实的控制棒和黄铜棒制造的单一护柱。

sentences.english: Wang Yihong's excellent work attributes to her solid exploit.
sentences.chinese: 汪一泓的出色工作属性，以她坚实的利用。

sentences.english: This is the solid basis and strong driving force for bilateral relations to continue to develop.
sentences.chinese: 这是中阿关系继续发展的坚实基础和强大动力。

sentences.english: Kapok is growing strong, just like the sturdy, silky flower.
sentences.chinese: 木棉剧团正在茁壮成长，就像美丽坚实的木棉花一样。

sentences.english: The ma-chine helps to firm the ground up.
sentences.chinese: 这台机器能把地面打坚实。

definition: to lay (a foundation)/to conquer (a city etc)/to shoot down (a bird etc)
solid as a boulder (idiom); absolutely secure/rock-firm and unyielding
to step out/to take a (first) step
